featureDesc: You have been trained to use Quick Combat Actions.
featureBenDesc: Gain a +1d4 Training bonus to roll results when using a Quick Combat Action. You no longer provoke an Attack of Opportunity while using a Quick Combat Action.

featureDesc: You have gained a little skill in the use of melee weapons.
featureBenDesc: Add +1 additional damage for any Melee Weapon that you use in Melee combat.

featureDesc: You can take more damage in combat.
featureBenDesc: Add +5 to your Hit Point Total.

featureDesc: You have gained a little skill in the use of ranged weapons.
featureBenDesc: Add +1 additional damage for any Ranged Weapon that you use in Ranged combat.

featureDesc: You have improved in the art of Ranged Combat.
featureBenDesc: Your Ranged attack bonus die increases to d6.

featureDesc: You have improved in the art of Melee Combat.
featureBenDesc: Your Melee attack bonus die increases to d6.

featureDesc: You have an enhanced ability to Recover.
featureBenDesc: Your Recovery die increased by one type.

featureDesc: You are now proficient with all types of “Heavy” Lesser and Greater armor.
featureBenDesc: You may now include your Melee attack die in your Combat Check roll while wearing “Heavy” armor in Melee Combat.

featureDesc: You are now proficient with all Medium and Kite shields.
featureBenDesc: You may now include your Melee attack die in your Combat check roll while using these types of shields in Melee Combat.
featureNote: If you face more than one opponent at a time, you may only use a shield’s bonus to Defense roll results against one of those opponents each round.

featureDesc: You are adept at finding the proper battle position.
featureBenDesc: Gain a +1d4 training bonus to Combat Check result if you are fighting adjacent to at least 2 companions. Each companion fighting on your flank gains a +1 training bonus to Combat Check result as long as they hold position next to you.
featureNote: Training bonuses stack with all additional bonuses except other training bonuses.

featureDesc: You know how to use battle positions to cover your flanks.
featureBenDesc: While using a shield along with Form Up, your training bonus die increases to d6.
featureNote: Training bonuses stack with all additional bonuses except other training bonuses.

featureDesc: Your training and experience has given you confidence in yourself and your abilities.
featureBenDesc: Your Battle Ready Training bonus to roll results when using a Quick Combat Action increases to a d6.

featureDesc: You shout your cry to bolster your courage and throw yourself into action.
featureBenDesc: Use battle cry at the beginning of an Encounter to gain a 1d4+1 bonus to Initiative.

featureDesc: Your skill allows you to get an extra strike at your opponent.
featureBenDesc: As part of a Full Round Melee attack action, you gain an additional +1d4 to your Combat check roll.

featureDesc: The thrill of battle consumes you.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you enter into a Combat Encounter and use ‘Battle Cry’, you become consumed by ‘Battle Rage’ for 2d4+2 rounds. While Enraged, you gain a +1d4 Rage bonus to all Combat rolls. While Enraged, you gain a +1d4 Rage bonus to all Mental and Spiritual Defense rolls against Fear, Sleep, and Mind Control effects. While Enraged, you suffer a +1d4 points of additional damage for each successful attack against you. While Enraged, your Ticker is reduced by 2 at the end of each round instead of 1.
featureNote: On the round after you no longer have an opponent to attack within Reach of 1 Pace, you are no longer Enraged and will lose all Rage modifiers.  This happens even if your die roll would indicate otherwise. At the end of any Encounter in which you use ‘Battle Rage’, you become Exhausted and cannot become Enraged again until you have had at least an hour of Rest.

featureDesc: You take a moment to prepare and defend.
featureBenDesc: If you choose, you may reduce your Ticker value by 1d4 in order to increase your Modifier value by that amount.

featureDesc: You may sacrifice initiative to gain attack power.
featureBenDesc: You may choose to decrease your Ticker value by 1d4 in order to gain this amount in additional damage.

featureDesc: You are able to react more quickly to an opponet's actions.
featureBenDesc: For you, Quick Combat actions are now used as Immediate actions instead of Partial Actions.

featureDesc: You can use one kind of weapon better than other kinds.
featureBenDesc: Choose a weapon (such as long sword) and add a +1 to your Modifier Value whenever you use this kind of weapon in combat.

featureDesc: You are skilled at using a specific type of one-handed, melee weapon.
featureBenDesc: While using a one-handed ‘Favored Weapon’ of your size category or smaller, you increase the weapon die type by one category.

featureDesc: You are skilled at using a specific type of ranged weapon.
featureBenDesc: While using a ranged ‘Favored Weapon’ of your size category or smaller, you increase the weapon die type by one category.

featureDesc: You are becoming skilled at dual-wielding.  You may use a melee weapon in your ‘shield hand’ without provoking an attack of opportunity.
featureBenDesc: While using a ‘Favored Weapon’ in your primary hand, you gain an additional melee attack each round made with an off-hand weapon at one die type lower than the weapon’s normal category. Your off-hand weapon must be at least one size category smaller than your character size category. You may apply this feature to the use of any double ended weapon, or to use both ends of a staff.

featureDesc: You are skilled at wielding a two-handed weapon.
featureBenDesc: While using a two-handed ‘Favored Weapon’ of your size category or smaller, you increase the weapon die type by one category.
featureNote: Using this Feature will decrease your Ticker Value by 1d4 at the start of any Encounter.

featureDesc: You are skilled at wielding a large two-handed weapon.
featureBenDesc: While using a two-handed ‘Favored Weapon’ of one size category larger than yourself, you increase the weapon die type by one category.
featureNote: Using this Feature will decrease your Ticker Value by 1d6 at the start of any Encounter.

featureDesc: You are skilled at wielding a ridiculously large two-handed weapon.
featureBenDesc: While using a two-handed ‘Favored Weapon’ of two size categories larger than yourself, you increase the weapon die type by one category.
featureNote: Using this Feature will decrease your Ticker Value by 1d8 at the start of any Encounter.

featureDesc: You can take more damage in combat.
featureBenDesc: Add +5 to your Hit Point Total.

featureDesc: You have gained experience as a warrior.
featureBenDesc: Your Melee attack bonus die increases to d8.

featureDesc: You have gained experience as a marksman.
featureBenDesc: Your Ranged attack bonus die increases to d8.

featureDesc: Your experience as a warrior has trained you to act decisively in combat situations.
featureBenDesc: Your Battle Ready Training bonus to roll results when using a Quick Combat Action increases to a d8. If you make a successful Combat Action against an opponent, you gain a +1d4 bonus to your next attack roll against that opponent.

featureDesc: You may put your opponent on the defensive and cause him to give ground to your advance.
featureBenDesc: While using ‘Forceful Combat’, you may choose to make an immediate Physical Action check as a free action. If you succeed at this check against your opponent’s Spiritual Defense roll, your opponent is immediately forced to decrease the Ticker value by 1d4 and then to surrender one full “Pace” of ground per round as long as you continue your ‘Forceful Advance’.
featureNote: If at any time you are attacked by an additional opponent, you will lose momentum and end your Forceful Advance.

featureDesc: You call out a forceful challenge to your opponent.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter as a Free Action, you may challenge an opponent to single combat. On a successful Spiritual Action check roll against a single opponent’s Spiritual Defense roll, you force that opponent to forsake all other potential opponents and attack you on her next available turn. The Opponent immediately decreases the Ticker value by 1d4 and you gain this number as a bonus to all Combat rolls against that opponent until either of you can no longer fight.
featureNote: ‘Warrior’s Challenge’ becomes inactive if you are ever unconscious or reduced to 0 Hit Points.

featureDesc: You can keep a smaller opponent or one with a smaller weapon from reaching you with her attacks.
featureBenDesc: As a free action if your Reach is +2 or more than an opponent’s Reach and you succeed at an Attack of Opportunity against that opponent after the opponent has entered your Reach, you may keep remain outside of the opponent's Reach as long as your Combat Check rolls continue to succeed against this opponent. While using this Feature, you gain a +1 bonus to your Combat Check result for every +1 that your Reach is greater than your opponent’s Reach. As long as your opponent is within your Reach and the opponent is not able to reach you, you may continue to take your Attacks of Opportunity against the opponent in addition to your normal attacks each round.

featureDesc: Your skill allows you to get an extra shot at your opponent.
featureBenDesc: As part of a Full Round Ranged attack action, you gain an additional +1d4 to your Combat check roll.

featureDesc: While moving through combat, you can try to hit an opponent within your reach.
featureBenDesc: You may make a free melee attack that does not include any armor modifiers while using ‘Tactical Mobility’ past any one opponent within your Reach. Successful attacks deal only half of your normal damage for the roll plus any additional damage.

featureDesc: You are becoming an expert with your Favored Weapon.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter while using a ‘Favored Weapon’, you may choose to re-roll your Combat Check. This Advantage can be used immediately after an otherwise failed attack has been resolved.
featureNote: You cannot use ‘Weapon Expertise’ while Enraged. You must notify the Storyteller of your desire to use this Feature immediately after the failed roll is resolved.

featureDesc: You have learned to pay attention to opponents on your flanks.
featureBenDesc: Opponents that attack on your Flank (full right or left side) no longer gain a +1d4 modifier to Combat Checks against you. Opponents who attack you from directly behind (“Back Attack”) now only gain a +1d4 against you instead of the usual +2d4 bonus.

featureDesc: You have trained to engage in Melee combat while unable to see.
featureBenDesc: Opponents now only gain +3d4 against you instead of the normal +5d4 while you are unable to see.

featureDesc: You are now proficient with all types of “Plate” armor.
featureBenDesc: You may now include your Melee attack roll with you Combat Check while wearing Plate armor.

featureDesc: You are now proficient with all Large and Legion shields.
featureBenDesc: You may now use your Melee attack die roll with your Combat Check while using these types of shields.
featureNote: If you face more than one opponent at a time, you may only use a shield’s bonus to Defense roll results against one of those opponents each round.

featureDesc: You are quite good at stabbing.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you use a ‘Favored’ Impaling weapon in melee combat, you deal +1d4 points of additional damage. Opponents suffer an additional decrease to Ticker value of 1 when you land a successful melee attack with this weapon.

featureDesc: You are quite good with a whip.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you use a ‘Favored’ Lashing weapon in melee combat, you deal +1d4 points of additional damage. Opponents suffer an additional decrease to Ticker value of 1 when you land a successful melee attack with this weapon.

featureDesc: Your lashing attack can hinder the movements of your opponent.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you make a successful Combat check roll against a single opponent while using a Lashing weapon in melee, the opponent must make an immediate Physical Ability check against 10+damage suffered or else be unable to act or move for the next round. For each additional round, the opponent must succeed at an opposed Physical Ability roll check against you.  Opponents affected by this ability may take a full round action to disengage from your weapon.
featureNote: Each round that you entangle your opponent, you are also unable to make an attack or use the weapon.

featureDesc: You are quite good at hitting things with a hammer-like weapon.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you use a ‘Favored’ Bashing weapon in melee combat, you deal +1d4 points of additional damage. Opponents suffer an additional decrease to Ticker value of 1 when you land a successful melee attack with this weapon.

featureDesc: If you are in melee combat with an opponent who is wearing Plate armor, you may choose to attack his armor as a Partial Action in order to lower his Armor bonus to Defense.
featureBenDesc: As a Quick Combat Action while using your ‘Favored’ Bashing weapon, you may make a Physical Action check roll against an opponent’s unarmored Physical Defense.  If you succeed, your opponent must decrease her Modifier and Ticker values by one.
featureNote: Use of this ability provokes an attack of opportunity against you.

featureDesc: You are quite good at carving into an opponent.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you use a ‘Favored’ Slicing weapon in melee combat, you deal +1d4 points of additional damage. Opponents suffer an additional decrease to Ticker value of 1 when you land a successful melee attack with this weapon.

featureDesc: If you are in melee combat with an opponent who is wearing cloth or leather armor, you may choose to attack her armor as a Combat Action in order to lower her Armor bonus to Defense.
featureBenDesc: As a Quick Combat Action while using your Favored Slicing weapon, you may make a Physical Action roll against an opponent’s unarmored Physical Defense.  If you succeed, your opponent must decrease her Modifier and Ticker values by one.
featureNote: Use of this ability provokes an attack of opportunity against you.

featureDesc: You have a mind that understands the strategies of battle.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter, if you hold your Turn and declare actions last in the Round, you can give all allies within 30’ of you a +1d4 Strategy bonus to all Combat checks resolved at the end of the round.
featureNote: You cannot use ‘Strategic Combat’ while Enraged.

featureDesc: You gain an additional ‘Favored Weapon’.
featureBenDesc: Choose another weapon and add +1 to your Modifier value whenever you use that kind of weapon.
